{{Infobox stadium | name = Allianz Dome | nickname = | image = Allianz Wall e Parquet.jpg | image_size = 250px | image_alt = | logo_image = Allianz Dome.jpg | caption = The central arena during an home match (2018) | fullname = Palazzo Dello Sport [[Cesare Rubini]] di Trieste[http://www.triesteoggi.tv/it/notizie-di-trieste/palasport-di-trieste-intitolato-a-cesare-rubini-campione-di-pallanuoto-e-basket-deceduto-alcuni-mesi-fa PALASPORT DI TRIESTE INTITOLATO A CESARE RUBINI] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170103100327/http://www.triesteoggi.tv/it/notizie-di-trieste/palasport-di-trieste-intitolato-a-cesare-rubini-campione-di-pallanuoto-e-basket-deceduto-alcuni-mesi-fa |date=2017-01-03 }}{{it icon}}[http://www.polistudio.net/default.asp?id=646 NUOVO PALAZZO DELLO SPORT DI TRIESTE]{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} | former_names = Palazzo Dello Sport di Trieste (1999-2011)
Alma Arena (2017-2018){{cite web |url=http://www.triesteprima.it/sport/palarubini-cambia-nome-alma-arena-28-novembre-2016.html |author= |date=28 November 2016 |title=Il PalaTrieste diventa "Alma Arena" |website=triesteprima.it |access-date=6 November 2017 |language=Italian |trans-title=PalaTrieste becomes "Alma Arena"}} | location = Via Flavia, 3 34100 [[Trieste|TRIESTE]] ([[Province of Trieste|TS]]), [[Italy]][http://195.56.77.208/team/?teamid=912 Telit Trieste] | coordinates = {{coord|45|37|21.99|N|13|47|41.84|E|type:landmark|display=inline,title}} | broke_ground = | built = 1994-1999 | opened = 1999 | renovated = | expanded = | closed = | demolished = | owner = [[Trieste|City of Trieste]] | operator = | surface = Parquet | scoreboard = | construction_cost = | architect = Studio TECO+ Partners (Bologna) | project_manager = | structural engineer = | services engineer = | general_contractor = | main_contractors = | capacity = 6,943 ([[Basketball]]) | record_attendance = | dimensions = | tenants = [[Alma Pallacanestro Trieste]] ([[Lega Basket Serie A|LBA]]) (1999-present) }} '''PalaTrieste''', or '''Allianz Dome''' for sponsorship reasons,{{cite web |url=https://www.ilgazzettino.it/nordest/trieste/l_alma_arena_cambia_nome_sara_allianz_dome_fino_al_2023-3794632.html |author= |date=13 June 2018 |title=L'Alma Arena cambia nome: sarà Allianz Dome fino al 2023 |website=ilgazzettino.it |access-date=17 June 2018 |language=Italian |trans-title=Alma Arena changes name: it will be Allianz Dome until 2023}} officially known as '''Palazzo dello sport [[Cesare Rubini]]''' is an [[indoor arena|indoor sporting arena]] located in [[Trieste]], [[Italy]]. Opened in 1999, it has a [[seating capacity]] for 6,943 people and is currently home for [[Alma Pallacanestro Trieste]] [[basketball]] team. ==History== ===Allianz sponsorship=== All started when, in 2015, [[Allianz]] became new top sponsor of the Italian basketball team [[Pallacanestro Trieste]], based in PalaTrieste.{{cite web |url=http://www.ilgiornaledellosport.net/notizie/basket/2016/09/26/66995-allianz-pallacanestro-trieste-2004-partnership-prosegue-la-stagione-20162017/ |author= |date=23 March 2017 |title=Allianz e Pallacanestro Trieste 2004: una partnership che prosegue per la stagione 2016/2017|website=ilgiornaledellosport.net|language=Italian |trans-title=Allianz and Pallacanestro Trieste 2004: a partnership that goes on for the 2016/2017 season}} In 2017, the German insurance company sponsored a new parquet basketball court,{{cite web |url=http://www.triesteprima.it/sport/allianz-italia-e-pallacanestro-trieste-2004-occasione-dell-allianz-day-la-partnership-porta-in-dote-il-nuovo-parquet-all-alma-arena-23-marzo-2017.html |author= |date=23 March 2017 |title=All'Alma arena come in Nba: nuovo parquet firmato Allianz|website=triesteprima.it|language=Italian |trans-title=Alma arena like Nba: new parquet sponsored by Allianz}} and later in 2018, a new scoreboard called ''Allianz Wall'' was installed in the Trieste arena.{{cite web |url=https://www.pallacanestrotrieste2004.it/allianz-wall-pronto-segnapunti-4-megaschermi-dellalma-arena/ |author= |date=13 March 2018 |title=ALLIANZ WALL: PRONTO IL NUOVO SEGNAPUNTI CON 4 MEGASCHERMI DELL’ALMA ARENA |website=pallacanestrotrieste2004.it |language=Italian |trans-title=Allianz Wall: new scoreboard of Alma Arena with 4 large screens is ready}} In 2018 Allianz signed a deal to became new title sponsor of the arena, so PalaTrieste officially became '''Allianz Dome''' until 2023.{{cite web |url=http://m.ilpiccolo.gelocal.it/sport/2018/06/12/news/trieste-allianz-sponsorizzera-il-palasport-del-basket-si-chiamera-allianz-dome-1.16955337 |author= |date=12 June 2018 |title=Trieste, Allianz sponsorizzerà il palasport del basket: si chiamerà Allianz Dome |website=ilpiccolo.gelocal.it |language=Italian |trans-title=Trieste, Allianz will sponsored the basketball palasport: it will be called Allianz dome}} ==Gallery== image:PalaTrieste.jpg|
PalaTrieste before the Allianz sponsorship (2007)
image:Palatrieste25-09-2010.jpg|
PalaTrieste during a volleyball match before new Allianz Wall (2010)
image:PalaRubini Allianz Dome.jpg|
New Allianz Dome logo outside the arena
image:L'esterno di PalaTrieste Allianz Dome.jpg|
Allianz Dome facade
 ==See also== * [[List of indoor arenas]] * [[List of basketball arenas]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.hsh.info/pala-ts.htm Photo of the arena under construction] {{Trieste}} [[Category:Basketball venues in Italy]] [[Category:Indoor arenas in Italy]] [[Category:Pallacanestro Trieste]] [[Category:Sports venues in Italy]] [[Category:Sports venues completed in 1999]] [[Category:1999 establishments in Italy]]

{{Infobox horseraces | class = Defunct Stakes | horse race = Tennessee Derby | image = | caption = | location = Memphis Fairgrounds
[[Memphis, Tennessee]], [[United States]] | inaugurated = 1884 | race type = [[Thoroughbred]] - [[Flat racing]] | website = | distance = {{frac|1|1|2}} miles (1884–1886),
{{frac|1|1|8}} miles (1890–1906) | surface = Dirt | track = | qualification = Three-year-olds | weight = [[Colt (horse)|Colts]], 122 lbs.; [[Gelding]]s, 119; [[Filly|Fillies]], 117 (1905 conditions)Goodwin's Annual Official Turf Guide for 1905, Volume 1, p. 395 | purse = Variable ($625–9,440) | bonuses = }} The '''Tennessee Derby''' was an [[United States|American]] Thoroughbred horse race that was run annually from 1884 to 1886 and then 1890–1906 at the [[Montgomery Park Race Track]] located on the Memphis Fairgrounds in [[Tennessee]]. The Tennessee Derby rivaled the [[Kentucky Derby]] at the time for prestige and purse money, but was not reinstated after a [[gambling]] ban took effect in 1907.[[Daily Racing Form]]. [http://kdl.kyvl.org/cgi/t/text/pageviewer-idx?c=drf1920s;cc=drf1920s;g=drf;xc=1;q1=tennessee%20derby;rgn=full%20text;idno=drf1921040401;didno=drf1921040401;view=pdf;seq=1_4;node=drf1921040401%3A1.4;passterms=1 April 4, 1921.] Kentucky Derby winners [[Joe Cotton (horse)|Joe Cotton]] and [[Agile (horse)|Agile]] also won the Tennessee Derby. ==Winners== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! style="background-color:#DACAA5; width:38px" | Year
! style="background-color:#DACAA5; width:145px"| Winner
! style="background-color:#DACAA5; width:150px"| Jockey

{{Infobox Basketball club | color1 = white | color2 = green | name = Torku Konyaspor | logo = Torku Konyaspor logo.png | image_size = | leagues = [[Turkish Basketball First League|TBL]] | founded = {{Start date and age|1987}} | history = '''Selçuk Üniversitesi'''
(1987–2014)
'''Torku Konyaspor'''
(2014–present) | arena = [[Selçuklu Belediyesi Sport Hall]] | capacity = 3,800 | location = [[Konya]], [[Turkey]] | colors = Green and White
{{color box|green}} {{color box|white}} | president = Hakan Faydasıçok | coach = [[Aziz Bekir]] | championships = | website = {{URL|http://www.konyasporbasket.org}} | h_body = FFFFFF | h_pattern_b = _greenshoulders | h_shorts = FFFFFF | h_pattern_s = _greensides | a_body = 009900 | a_pattern_b = _whiteshoulders | a_shorts = 009900 | a_pattern_s = _whitesides }} '''Torku Konyaspor Basket''', is a professional [[basketball]] team from the city of [[Konya]] in [[Turkey]]. The team current plays in the [[Turkish Basketball First League]]. ==History== The club was founded by [[Selçuk University]] in 1987. In August 2014 the club changed its name to Konyaspor Basketbol in order to gain more support from the citizens of Konya and fangroups from Konyaspor. The club has no ties to the [[Konyaspor|football club of Konya]] but only changed its for better sponsorship and fangroups reasons. ==History== * Selçuk Üniversitesi (1987–2006) * Mutlu Akü Selçuk Üniversitesi (2006–2009) * [[Torku]] Selçuk Üniversitesi (2010–2014) * Torku Konyaspor Basket (2014–present) ==Season by season== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:85%" !Season !Tier !League /* Current hierarchical divisional breakdowns */ {{Category see also|Water polo clubs in Spain}}
revision.text:
The [[Spain|Spanish]] [[water polo]] league is divided into divisions. The top teams play in the División de Honor. In each division, a team plays all other teams twice, once at home and once away.
The Spanish league teams compete in [[Europe]] under the [[Ligue Européenne de Natation]], most notably in the [[LEN Euroleague]] and [[LEN Cup]], and previously in the [[LEN Cup Winners' Cup]]. The teams also compete in a domestic cup competition each year, called the [[Copa del Rey de Waterpolo|Copa del Rey]]. The winners of the División de Honor play against the winners of the Copa del Rey in the [[Supercopa de España de Waterpolo]] (Super Cup).
==Current hierarchical divisional breakdowns== * [[División de Honor de Waterpolo|División de Honor]] (12 teams) * [[Primera División de Waterpolo|Primera División]] (12 teams) * [[Segunda División de Waterpolo|Segunda División]] (12 teams)
{{Category see also|Water polo clubs in Spain}}
==Current female hierarchical divisional breakdowns==
* [[División de Honor Femenina de Waterpolo|División de Honor Femenina]] (12 teams) * [[Primera División de Waterpolo Femenina|Primera División Femenina]] (6 teams)
For a list of teams, see [[List of waterpolo clubs in Spain]]
The [[Spain national women's water polo team]] represents the whole country.
== Others Competitions== *[[Copa del Rey de Waterpolo]] *[[Supercopa de España de Waterpolo]] *[[Copa de la Reina de Waterpolo]]
==External links== *[http://www.rfen.es/ Real Federación Española de Natación Official Website] *[http://www.wpaweb.es/ Asociación Española de Clubes de Waterpolo Official Website]
[[Category:Water polo in Spain| ]] {{Sport in Spain}}
